data.text: Then stood up Elijah the prophet as fire,
He brought a sore famine upon them,
By the word of the Lord he shut up the heaven,
O Elijah, how wast thou honored in thy wondrous deeds!
Who didst raise up a dead man from death,
Who broughtest kings to destruction,
Who heardest the rebuke of the Lord in Sinai,
Who anointedst kings to take revenge,
Who wast taken up in a whirlwind of fire,
Who wast ordained for reproofs in their times,
Blessed are they that saw thee,
Elijah it was, who was covered with a whirlwind;
No word could overcome him;
He did wonders in his life,
For all this the people repented not,
Of whom some did that which was pleasing to God,
Hezekiah fortified his city,
In his time Sennacherib came up,
Then trembled their hearts and hands,
But they called upon the Lord who is merciful,
He smote the host of the Assyrians,
For Hezekiah had done the thing that pleased the Lord,
In his time the sun went backward,
He saw by an excellent spirit what should come to pass at the last,
He showed what should come to pass forever,
